0.title: 2021 Richard G. Law Excellence Award for Undergraduate Teaching
0.description: The Richard G. Law Excellence Award for Undergraduate Teaching is given to recognize outstanding teaching by faculty in Washington State University’s UCORE program. Applications are due April 1, 2021. Awards will be announced in mid to late April 2021.

fields.label: Intro: Applicant Information
fields.content: Note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this nomination form so we can help you.

fields.label: Form reminders: Nomination Statement
fields.content: Note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this nomination form so we can help you.

fields.label: Instructions for Uploading Nomination Statement
fields.content: Please upload a nomination statement (3-5 pages) that addresses the award criteria listed above this nomination form.

fields.label: Form reminders: Additional Support Document
fields.content: Note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this nomination form so we can help you.

fields.label: Instructions for Uploading Additional Support Document
fields.content: Please upload one additional support document (e.g., syllabus, assignment prompt, results of assessment of teaching and learning) that speaks to the nominee's approach to or effectiveness of teaching.

  5. About Letters of Support

nextButton.text: On to About Letters of Support →

fields.label: Form reminders: About Letters of Support
fields.content: Note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this nomination form so we can help you.

fields.label: Instructions for Letters of Support Section
fields.content: Please provide contact details for two to three people that will separately provide letters of support for the nominee. These people should be colleagues, alumni, or community partners — ideally, at least one letter should be from a former student. Once you submit this nomination form, these people will be contacted via an automated notification email that will provide instructions for submitting their letters of support.

Name of the second support letter writer

confirmations.name: Default Confirmation
confirmations.message:
Nomination Submitted

We have received your nomination of Daniel Rieck for a Richard G. Law Excellence Award for Undergraduate Teaching for 2021. Notifications regarding Law Awards will be emailed to nominators by mid April. If you have any questions, please contact the Law Award Committee at daesa.provost@wsu.edu.

Record of Submission

{all_fields}

notifications.name: Nominator notification of submission
notifications.subject: Your nomination of {Nominee name (First):1.3} for a Law award has been received
notifications.message:
Dear {Nominator Name (First):45.3},

We are delighted to have received your nomination of {Nominee name (First):1.3} {Nominee name (Last):1.6} for a Law Award for 2021.

The Law Award recognizes excellence in the area of undergraduate teaching. The awards value the important role played by general education faculty across the university in helping students attain WSU learning goals. Recipients of this award are known to inspire curiosity and understanding of an area of study. Their classes encourage development of the lifelong learning skills of integrating and synthesizing concepts to solve real problems.

Notifications regarding Law Awards will be emailed to nominators by mid-April.

Sincerely,

Members of the Law Award Committee

{all_fields}

notifications.name: Self-nominator notification of submission
notifications.subject: Your self-nomination for a Law award has been received
notifications.message:
Dear {Nominee name (First):1.3},

We are delighted to have received your application for a Law Award for 2021.

The Law Award recognizes excellence in the area of undergraduate teaching. The awards value the important role played by general education faculty across the university in helping students attain WSU learning goals. Recipients of this award are known to inspire curiosity and understanding of an area of study. Their classes encourage development of the lifelong learning skills of integrating and synthesizing concepts to solve real problems.

Notifications regarding Law Awards will be emailed to nominators by mid-April.

{all_fields}

notifications.name: Request for Letter of Support - 1
notifications.subject: Letter needed to support {Nominee name (First):1.3} {Nominee name (Last):1.6} for a Law award nomination
notifications.message:
Dear {Letter Writer 1 Name (First):33.3},

Each year, WSU faculty who provide outstanding teaching are eligible to self-nominate, or be nominated, to receive the Richard G. Law Excellence Award for Undergraduate Teaching. You were listed in a recent nomination of {Nominee name (First):1.3} {Nominee name (Last):1.6} as someone who can provide a letter supporting their consideration for a Law award. In total, 2-3 such letters are required to complete the nomination process by the deadline of April 1, 2021.

We thank you for providing this letter of support. To help you with this worthy endeavor, we encourage you to explore the Law Award’s selection criteria and other details provided on the DAESA website. In your letter of support and to ease process of reviewing award candidates, please include the nominee’s name and mention the Law Award in the subject line of your letter.

When you have finished preparing your letter, please submit it using a short online form we have provided on the DAESA website for collecting support letters. After completing the form, you will receive an email to let you know that your submission of the letter was successful.

Sincerely,

Members of the Law Award Committee
